description.narrative:
- 700 IDP households (mostly female-headed households in Wau - 400HHs in Mayendit Total 1100HHs (6600 people)
The selection criteria will target lactating and pregnant women, single mothers, households with children under 5 year and elderly people >65 years. In Wau, only female-headed households, which are more vulnerable, that fulfil the above criteria will be targeted.

In 2017, the Government of South Sudan, in concurrence by UNOCHA, has declared Unity State of South Sudan was under famine situation. WFP estimated about 174,000 civilian population were in IPC phase 4/ 5 (famine situation) in Leer, Mayendit and Koch counties of Unity State. These counties suffered from prolonged conflicts between government forces and the opposition, leading to massive internal displacement and cut-off from humanitarian supplies at times. Urgent response was paramount for timely life-saving assistance. Since early 2017, increased conflict in Wau also led to increased number of IDPs staying in Wau – with 35000 IDPs at its peak. These IDPs were stranded in Wau town without any livelihoods means and Wau was also ranked under IPC level 4 in 2018.
After coordination with other agencies, Cordaid decided to respond in Wau (self-implementation) and Mayendit county with partner UNIDO.

Objective: to support crisis-affected households that have high risks of food insecurity in Wau (Western Bahr el Ghazal) and Mayendit (Unity) county, South Sudan to restore their livelihoods, for enhanced food consumption level. a) Provision of Conditional cash grant for livelihoods, accompanied with trainings, to 700 IDP fe-male-headed households in Wau b) Provision of farming and fishery kits to 400HHs in Mayendit
